result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Michael Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Def granted credit for time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
The Def is to pay their financial obligations @ not less than 25% of their prison income.

6/5/17 JUDGMENT AMENDED. PAYMENTS FROM PRISON INCOME TO BE DEDUCTED FROM WAGES ONLY, GIFTS OF MONEY FROM FAMILY ARE EXCLUDED.
By the 2nd Yr of ES def needs to be employed (at least 10 hr/wk or full-time).

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendations.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
Def to have NO contact w/co-def's & Yolanda Volak (only contact w/her is as directed by DOC & for purposes of parenting decisions).
Def to have NO contact w/known drug/meth users.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
Pyble to:  City of Ashland Police Deptmt (buy $)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
